name: Mexican Strawberry Water (Agua de Fresa)
author: Olivia
summary: Fresh fruit waters, or Aguas de Frutas, made with crushed or blended fruit are a common and popular drink all over Mexico. This recipe is extremely flavorful and refreshing, especially when fresh strawberries are in season.
directions: In a medium bowl, mix together sliced strawberries, sugar, and 1 cup of water
Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and place in the refrigerator for 4 hours
Remove the strawberry mixture from the refrigerator and pour into a blender
Pour the blended berry mixture through a wire mesh strainer set over a large mixing bowl; discard the pulp and seeds
Add the remaining 7 cups cold water to the pureed strawberries and mix well
Place the Aqua de Fresa in the refrigerator to chill for several hours or pour over ice and serve immediately
Garnish with lime slices or mint leaves
